I totally understand I was just curious, to be honest I already you know about your aversion to using "required" plugins. I was curious as to if you were going to make your own plugin which would have been above and beyond epic. But I know that might be a little too much especially since its purpose would have only been for one rocket. Anyway like I said its really nice and I look forward to it. Good Luck.
Looking great!!! Keep it cool
So wait beale, Will there be a conical engine and a Block D(Not the transfer stage, the Blok-D) for use with your TBA TLV?

I know this is the case, but I just can't bring myself to introduce dependencies, if it came to something like this, I'd have to code it myself and bundle it in Tantares.dll

Please, never ever introduce any dependencies.

There is some solid-built plugins that could withstand many updates, like SelectRoot. And then there is KSP API Exstensions, which is literally made from glass and breaks every time, breaking all dependent mods in process.

And please, if it ever comes to your own plugin, don't use "Compatibility Checker" thingie... There was (and is) a mod, called Kerbal NRAP. It worked (and works) fine, until stupid_chris implemented said Checker. Now stupid_chris temporarily retired from modding, NRAP spams "This is not the version I'm looking for!" message during load, and there is no one to fix it. Know what's funny? If you'll get an old version, it will work fine with 0.25 - and without any nagging. Sure, it's harmless - but it still annoying.

I would say, rather, make optional dependencies. This mod can benefit from a lot of different mods (Interstellar or LTech come to mind for station science). However, I agree that that is not everyone's cup of tea. Perhaps keep a group of mod manager files, for example, that can inject interoperability.
Will we eventually get a HLV? Perhaps a proper, stack Energia clone? I would really love to have an option for heavy-lift capacity that didn't end up looking like either the N1 or the Saturn V.
I'm thinking we shouldn't focus as much on the rockets as a lot of them can be built from other packs. The Energia can be built (pretty closely) using KW Rocketry.

I'm thinking we shouldn't focus as much on the rockets as a lot of them can be built from other packs. The Energia can be built (pretty closely) using KW Rocketry.

He's got a point while I do wish every one of my rockets could have the amazing style and stock-feel as this pack, I sometimes take pride in assembling my own creation that wasn't a selection of parts MADE for a specific thing which is why packs with modularity (KW, FASA, NovaPunch, B9) are so popular. So if anything, I would propose that modular parts that are stock-alike and of this style would be the best.

But let's not throw too many ideas at Beale as he's already been pumping out project after project, we certainly don't wanna overwhelm him.

I for one am far more interested in stuff that hasn't really been done before. I would like to see a proper Lunokhod/Luna before seeing a whole lot of rockets. Rovers are becoming much more interesting contract wise, but are SO neglected.

Beale, I think I found a thread, describing the problem you have with the Vega Science lab and it has a kind of solution:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69993-Science-Lab-Module-migration-problem

Makes the idea of a manned ATV seem pretty cool.

Interesting idea! Here's what I came up with mashing the mods in the other direction. Quite snazzy looking if you ask me.
